decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly dropping low-cost artifact creatures onto the battlefield and equipping them with Cranial Plating to deal massive damage to the opponent. Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager are key cards in boosting the power of the creatures, while Mox Opal allows for quick mana acceleration. The inclusion of Pia's Revolution adds a recursion element to the deck, forcing the opponent to take damage or sacrifice their own creatures when they destroy your artifacts. This aggressive strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing creatures like Simian Spirit Guide and planeswalkers like Nahiri, Gideon Jura, and Chandra, Torch of Defiance. It also includes removal spells like Wrath of God and Anger of the Gods to clear the board. The deck's win condition lies in assembling the Nahiri + Emrakul combo to quickly close out the game. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void disrupt opponent's game plan, while Lightning Helix provides some lifegain and removal. The deck aims to control the game and win through a powerful combo finish.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Nahiri, the Harbinger to remove threats and disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck also includes board wipes like Wrath of God and Anger of the Gods to clear the battlefield, along with disruptive cards like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void. The end goal is to control the game until the player can ultilize Nahiri's ultimate ability to cheat in Emrakul, the Aeons Torn for a game-winning attack.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their strategy with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. The deck aims to use mana efficiently with the Urza lands and ramp into big threats like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The Basilisk Collar provides additional utility by attaching to Walking Ballista for removal or lifegain. Overall, this Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent while maintaining control of the game through powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

Utilize a mix of mana acceleration and disruptive creatures to quickly overwhelm opponents with powerful Eldrazi creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher while accelerating its own game plan with cards like Noble Hierarch and Ancient Stirrings. Eldrazi Displacer provides additional disruption and can be used to repeatedly flicker powerful creatures for value. Overall, this deck focuses on applying pressure early and maintaining control of the game until victory is achieved.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and control the board through land destruction and powerful creatures, while maintaining a steady ramp strategy using Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf. Using cards like Blood Moon, Stone Rain, and Mwonvuli Acid-Moss, along with powerful threats like Inferno Titan and Thragtusk, this deck aims to establish early control and maintain pressure throughout the game. With a mix of removal, ramp, and threats, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and take control of the game.

The deck is focused on playing threats early and pressuring the opponent with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Grim Flayer, and Tasigur. It also includes disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek, Thoughtseize, and Path to Exile to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay, Maelstrom Pulse, and Fatal Push to handle opposing threats. Finally, the deck can generate additional value with cards like Lingering Souls and planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope, while also gaining incremental advantage with cards like Shambling Vent and Gavony Township.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible, using fast and efficient spells like Lava Spike, Lightning Bolt, and Searing Blaze. The creatures in the deck, such as Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, also contribute to this aggressive strategy by attacking the opponent directly. The deck also includes cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Atarka's Command to punish the opponent for casting spells, making it difficult for them to stabilize. With a low mana curve and a focus on direct damage, this deck aims to win quickly and decisively.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with fast and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, Wild Nacatl, and Eidolon of the Great Revel, while also using burn spells like Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, Lightning Bolt, Searing Blaze, Boros Charm, and Atarka's Command to deal direct damage and finish off the opponent quickly. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a defense.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear alongside powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze further punishes opponents for playing spells and creatures, creating a fast-paced and high-pressure gameplay experience.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Scapeshift to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. It includes ramp spells like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Farseek to accelerate the game plan, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods to control the board. Primeval Titan can fetch Valakut or additional Mountains, while Explore and Search for Tomorrow help dig for key pieces. The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana, find the combo pieces, and win the game with a devastating Scapeshift.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana with cards like Farseek, Sakura-Tribe Elder, and Search for Tomorrow in order to quickly play Primeval Titan or Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield through cards like Through the Breach. Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle serves as the win condition, dealing damage to the opponent every time a Mountain enters the battlefield. The deck utilizes a combo strategy by utilizing powerful threats and quickly assembling the pieces needed to deal lethal damage to the opponent.

This deck focuses on taking extra turns to gain tempo advantage over the opponent. By utilizing cards like Time Warp, Temporal Mastery, and Part the Waterveil, the player can loop extra turns to set up win conditions or disrupt the opponent's game plan. Cards like Gigadrowse and Exhaustion help stall the opponent while Howling Mine and Dictate of Kruphix provide card advantage. Cryptic Command and Remand offer flexibility and disruption, while Telling Time and Serum Visions help with card selection. Overall, this deck aims to control the game and win through overwhelming advantage gained from extra turns.
